FuncDef:
The ipv6 maximum load-balancing command sets the maximum number of IPv6 IS-IS equal-cost routes for load balancing according to the memory capacity.
The undo ipv6 maximum load-balancing command restores the default value.
By default, IPv6 load balancing is supported, and a maximum of 64 IPv6 IS-IS equal-cost routes can load-balance traffic.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of equal-costs for load balancing.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 64.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the maximum number of IPv6 IS-IS equal-cost routes for load balancing, run the ipv6 maximum load-balancing command. The ipv6 maximum load-balancing command takes effect only after IPv6 is enabled for the IS-IS process. For details, see isis ipv6 enable.
